SEARCH
Package model

Class Library

java.lang.Object
model.Library
public class Library extends Object
The Library class represents a library and provides functionality related to managing products and pages. Each library is associated with a user and contains a collection of products.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Library(String userName, ArrayList<Product> products)
    Constructs a Library object with the given user name and list of products.

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library(String userName, ArrayList<Product> products)
      Constructs a Library object with the given user name and list of products.
      Parameters:
      userName - The name of the user associated with the library.
      products - The list of products in the library.

  • Method Details

    • getROWS

      public int getROWS()
      Returns the number of rows in the library matrix
      Returns:
      the number of rows

    • getProductIdByCoord

      public String getProductIdByCoord(int row, int column)
      Returns the product ID at the specified coordinates in the library matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index.
      column - The column index.
      Returns:
      The product ID.

    • nextPage

      public void nextPage()
      Moves to the next page in the library. If there are no more pages, the current page remains unchanged.

    • previousPage

      public void previousPage()
      Moves to the previous page in the library. If already on the first page, the current page remains unchanged.

    • updateProducts

      public void updateProducts()
      Updates the product arraylist by sorting and assigning it to the array. Since it is pointing to the same reference, it is not necessary to add the new products to it. Adjusts the number of rows in the matrix to be a multiple of 5.

    • sortProductsByDate

      public void sortProductsByDate()
      sorts products by publish date

    • arraylistToMatrix

      public void arraylistToMatrix()
      Converts the product ArrayList to a matrix representation. Each row in the matrix corresponds to a page in the library. Empty cells are filled with "---" if there are fewer products than the matrix size.

    • matrixToString

      public String matrixToString()
      Converts the matrix representation of the library to a formatted string.
      Returns:
      The string representation of the matrix.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the library, including the user's name, the matrix, and instructions for navigation.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the library.
